name: homonym
content:

a word that sounds the same or is spelled the same as another word but has a different meaning: "No" and "know" are homonyms. "Bow" (bend at the waist) and "bow" (weapon) are also homonyms.
a word that has the same spelling and pronunciation as another word but a different meaning: Jokes and wordplay often rely on homonyms, for example "I cannot bear to see a bear." Compare
homograph
homophone
More examplesFewer examplesThe spell-check does not catch homonyms ("hear" for "here," wring" for "ring," etc.).In Chinese, his last name is a homonym for "little bottle."
